4.	 Five-Year Accident History

The ALEUS facility at 3322 Road N NE has had no accidental releases of hydrogen that have resulted in an offsite consequence in the past five years.  

5.	The Emergency Response Program

The facility utilizes an Emergency Action Plan, Standard Operating Procedures (SOPs), and Emergency Action Plan Training to ensure personnel are trained to identify and respond to accident and emergency situations.

Actual response to an emergency would be by the City of Moses Lake Fire Department. The facility would respond to accidental releases from the covered process by:
-	Notification of all persons on site;
-	Notification of contiguous industrial site by telephone;
-	Notification of local fire department by telephone;
-	Stopping equipment and isolating any equipment which may leak flammable gases;
-	Isolation of bulk tank via remote emergency stop; and
-	Evacuation of the area.

Coordination is with the local fire department and LEPC.
6.	 Planned Changes to Improve Safety
Two carbon monoxide (CO) monitors will be added in the PAE SMR building (one above the PSA valves and one next to the high temperature shift area).  The LEL monitors in the control room cabinet are being upgraded.

1.	Accidental Release and Emergency Response Policies

The ALEUS operation at 3322 Road N NE utilizes the following accidental release prevention and emergency response policies at the stationary source:
-	Systems are designed by engineers
-	Standard operating procedures to ensure the facility is operated as designed
-	Management of change to ensure the covered process is not altered without a safety review
-	Operator training to ensure correct operating procedure (SOP)
-	Operator training to ensure emergency response including shutting down systems to limit the impact of potential release
-	Enforcement of area electrical classification and conforming equipment
-	Safety training for all personnel on site

2.	Facility and Regulated Substances Handled

The substance which triggers 40 CFR 68 compliance is hydrogen, stored in both liquid and gas form. The primary function of the ALEUS facility is to supply bulk gasses to our customer via pipeline on a 24 hour, 365-day basis. Bulk gasses other than hydrogen are inert and non-regulated by this program (nitrogen). The facility manufactures hydrogen by process of catalytic reformation. During the process of manufacturing hydrogen, methane is combined with steam at high temperatures in a two-phase reaction to generate hydrogen and water. Hydrogen is stored in liquid form in stationary bulk tanks and transported in gaseous form via pipeline to the on-site customer.

The ALEUS includes two 2,765 cubic foot (20,000 US gallon) vacuum-insulated cryogenic, horizontal) tanks of liquefied hydrogen, two 4,000 cubic foot (30,000 US gallon (horizontal) tanks of hydrogen gas, and small amounts of hydrogen within the process vessels and piping.

3.	 The General Accidental Release Prevention Program and Chemical-Specific Prevention Steps

The following specific practices are employed:
-	Employees are consulted and trained on the process using standard operating procedures.
